<s>[INST] Simplify the following so that a child will understand: The transformation of a neighbourhood's demographic and character that ensues when affluent individuals move in causing real estate value (and thus rent and property taxes) to increase and forcing less affluent long-time resident to relocate. [/INST] When rich people move into a neighborhood, it gets more expensive and the people who used to live there have to move away.  The neighborhood changes and becomes more fancy.  This is called gentrification.  It happens a lot in big cities.  The people who have to move away are usually not as rich as the new people.  This can be a problem because it can make the city less diverse and more expensive.  It can also make it hard for the old people to find a new place to live.  The new people might not like the old people and the old people might not like the new people.  This can cause problems and make the neighborhood not as nice.
